titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 05/12/09 ordering plaintiff shall submit within 30 days from the date of this order, a completed affidavit in support of his request to proceed in forma pauperis on the form provided by the clerk of court. The clerk of the court shall send plaintiff a new application to proceed IFP by a prisoner. Plaintiff shall submit within 30 days from the date of this order, a certified copy of his prison trust account statement for the 6 month period immediately preceding the filing of the complaint. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 9/28/09 ORDERING that pltf's 12 and 14 requests to proceed IFP are GRANTED; pltf to pay the $350.00 filing fee in accordance w/ the concurrent CDC order; service is appropriate for dfts A. Ralls, B. P. Scruggs, S. A. Ramirez and C. Macarvel; the clerk to send pltf forms for service to be completed and returned w/in 30 days, along w/ the Notice of Submission.(Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER DIRECTING MONTHLY PAYMENTS be made from Prison Account of Amilcar Guevara signed by Magistrate Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 9/28/09. CDC is to collect monthly payments and fwd to the clerk until the $350 filing fee is paid in full. Clerk is directed to serve this order and copy of pltf's IFP on the Director of CDC. Clerk to also serve Financial w/ a copy of this order. (cc: CDC, Financial)(Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 4/28/10 Recommending that the Motion to Dismiss filed on 2/17/10 35 be DENIED and defendant McCarvel answer the complaint within sixty days. These Findings and Recommendations are submitted to United State District Judge Frank C. Damrell, Jr. Within twenty one days after being served with these Findings and Recommendations, any party may file written objections with the Court and serve a copy on all parties. (Mena-Sanchez, L)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 6/18/2010 ORDERING that the 64 Order to Show Cause is DISCHARGED; pltf's 47 motion to compel production of the video recording is DENIED; pltf's 47 motion to compel further production of docs is GRANTED in part and DENIED in part; pltf's 68 request for nunc pro tunc extension to serve request for admissions is DENIED; pltf's 69 request to shorten the deadline by which dft McCarvel must file a responsive pleading is DENIED; pltf's 70 request is PARTIALLY GRANTED re dft McCarvel's answer and responses; pltf's 71 motion to compel dft Ramirez to fully respond to the 3/15/10 set of interrogatories is DENIED w/out prejudice.(See order for details) (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 3/29/2012 ORDERING 128 FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS are ADOPTED in full; Defendants' motions for summaryjudgment based on Heck v. Humphrey, 512 USC 477 (1994) are DENIED; 85 Motion for Summary Judgment is GRANTED as to defendants Scruggs, Ramirez and McCarvel; 102 Motion for Summary Judgment by defendant Ralls is DENIED. (Waggoner, D)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 8/22/12 ORDERING that within thirty days from the date of this order, plaintiff shall file the attached notice of election form indicating whether he wishes to re-open the motion for summary judgment. Failure to timely respond to this order shall be deemed plaintiff's waiver to the defects in the timing of the notice of the motions for summary judgment, and this case will proceed to trial as scheduled.(Matson, R)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:09-cv-01132; (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 8/22/12 ORDERING that within thirty days from the date of this order, plaintiff shall file the attached notice of election form indicating whether he wishes to re-open the motion for summary judgment. Failure to timely respond to this order shall be deemed plaintiff's waiver to the defects in the timing of the notice of the motions for summary judgment, and this case will proceed to trial as scheduled.(Matson, R)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 9/18/12 ORDERING that the March 8, 2012 findings and recommendations and the September 24, 2012 order 128, 129 are VACATED, in part, only as to the rulings on defendants September 24, 2010 motion for summary judgment; Defendants 85 motion for summary judgment is DENIED without prejudice; Within 30 days from the date of this order, defendants Ramirez, Scruggs, and Macarvel shall re- file the motion for summary judgment, accompanied by the attached notice; The 130 further scheduling order is VACATED; and the November 1, 2012 trial confirmation hearing, and the December 10, 2012 jury trial, set before the undersigned, are VACATED.(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 08/02/13 recommending that defendants' motion for summary judgment base on Heck be denied. The 9/27/12 motion for summary judgment 137 be granted as to defendants Scruggs, Ramirez and McCarvel and this case be remanded to the undersigned for scheduling as to plaintiff's remaining claim against defendant Ralls. MOTION for SUMMARY JUDGMENT 137 referred to Judge Troy L. Nunley; Objections due within 14 days. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER adopting 146 FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS IN FULL signed by District Judge Troy L. Nunley on 10/2/13: Defendants' motion for summary judgment based on Heck v. Humphrey, 512 U.S. 477 (1994), is denied. MOTION for summary judgment 137 is granted as to defendants Scruggs, Ramirez and McCarvel. This matter is remanded to the magistrate judge for scheduling as to plaintiff's remaining claim against defendant Ralls.(Kaminski, H)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FURTHER SCHEDULING ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 10/11/13 ORDERING that Discovery is closed. Law and motion is closed. Plaintiff shall file and serve his pretrial statement and any motions necessary to obtain the attendance of witnesses at trial on or before December 13, 2013. Defendants shall file their pretrial statement on or before February 13, 2014. This matter is set for jury trial before the Honorable Troy L. Nunley on May 19, 2014, at 9:00 a.m., in Courtroom #2.(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Guevara v. Ralls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER AND FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 1/2/2014 ORDERING that defendants are relieved from filing a pretrial statement; the 3/21/2014 pretrial conference is VACATED; and RECOMMENDING that this action be dismissed without prejudice. Referred to Judge Troy L. Nunley; Objections due within 14 days. (Yin, K)
